alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hamilton; Kearny; Morton; Stanton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 10 at 12:54PM CDT until April 11 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Risk of Wildfires Tuesday and Wednesday... ...Critical Fire Danger Along and West of Highway 25... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM CDT /10 AM MDT/ TO 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 061, 062, 074, 075, 084, AND 085... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 061, 062, 074, 075, 084, AND 085... * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 061 Hamilton, Fire Weather Zone 062 Kearny, Fire Weather Zone 074 Stanton, Fire Weather Zone 075 Grant, Fire Weather Zone 084 Morton and Fire Weather Zone 085 Stevens. * WINDS...Tuesday: South 15 to 25 mph, gusts to 35 mph. Wednesday: South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Tuesday: As low as 14 percent. Wednesday: As low as 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Given the ongoing drought and continued dormant vegetation, any ignitions will have the potential to burn out of control quickly. Any outdoor burning, or outdoor activities involving sparks or flames, should be avoided.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
